column4: lsilZha: i think tty4 give you some more info about what is happening
lsilZha: I dunno - I'm a relative noob ;)
i know jsut enough to screw things up *properly*
he asks for some input continuesly. how would i provide him with the input he wants?
lsilZha: what is it asking for?
it asks me to either say yes or no
lsilZha: is it apt asking if you want to continue installing packages?
yes
lsilZha: then make it happy, say 'yes'
how? in tty1? or 4? i tried both already...
lsilZha: ah, tty4 isn't accepting input from the keyboard?
no it's just littering my hd with posting this question twice a second...
lsilZha: sorry, but I've not seen that before
does anyone else know?
my remaining space reaches 1 gb... is there a way to clear up what was wrote to tty4 so far?
lsilZha: sorry dude, I don't know
anybody got an idea? i'm running short of time....
lsilZha: in the absence of other ideas, maybe just terminate the install and restart it?
the problem is that he runs this automatically. it would give me more time... but it wouldn't solve the problem
any powerpc users here that can help me with my kernel problem?
does 2.6.12-10 even support old world openfirmware?
that's a pretty broad question
what kind?
i got to go anyway... thanks for trying to help me out
